entry.title: Experiencing lag on Monitor API
entry.content:
Apr 2, 08:07 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Apr 1, 09:45 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented, we are monitoring the issue.

Apr 1, 08:20 UTC
Investigating - We are experiencing some latency on our Monitoring API since around 08:20 UTC

entry.title: Missing Data in Monitoring API
entry.content:
Mar 10, 18:17 UTC
Resolved - Everything is operational.

Mar 10, 13:12 UTC
Monitoring - Between 12:02 and 12:15 UTC, some misconfiguration caused some recording metadata missing from monitor API in prod US / EU regions.
No data are lost. We are re-processing the missing data.

entry.title: Dolby.io dashboard authentication service
entry.content:
Feb 13, 05:00 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Feb 13, 03:02 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 10, 21:08 UTC
Scheduled - During this scheduled maintenance window following services will be impacted:

- Dolby.io dashboard (including login and new signup)

There will be no impact on product API services, and customers' applications will continue to work.

entry.title: Not able to create conferences
entry.content:
Feb 9, 10:30 UTC
Resolved - During a software update, manual misconfiguration lands into not being able to create any conference on the platform. This issue happened from 10:42 AM UTC to 11:01 AM UTC

entry.title: Canada Datacenter websocket failures
entry.content:
Jan 22, 16:54 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 22, 11:31 UTC
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Jan 22, 11:31 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jan 22, 02:56 UTC
Update - Canada traffic is now being routed to the US. Customers using regional media zones for Canada will still see degraded service. Investigation is still ongoing.

Jan 22, 01:30 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating websocket failures occurring in the Canada datacenter.

entry.title: Dolby.io dashboard authentication service migration
entry.content:
Dec 16, 19:30 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Dec 16, 18:30 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Dec 16, 17:56 UTC
Scheduled - During this scheduled maintenance window (expected to be about an hour), login to the dolby.io dashboard will not be available. When trying to log in to the dashboard during the maintenance period, the user will see the maintenance notice page, and currently, logged-in users will be logged out automatically. New users will not be able to signup during the downtime. There will be no impact on API services, and customers' applications will continue to work.

entry.title: Dolby.io dashboard authentication service upgrade
entry.content:
Dec 16, 17:00 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Dec 16, 16:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Dec 15, 01:34 UTC
Scheduled - A maintenance event is scheduled between 16:00 UTC - 17:00 UTC (08:00 PST - 09:00 PST ) on Dec 16, 2021. Actual service interruption during this window is expected to take approximately 30 minutes.

During this scheduled maintenance window (expected to be about an hour), login to the dolby.io dashboard will not be available. When trying to log in to the dashboard during the maintenance period, the user will see the maintenance notice page, and currently, logged-in users will be logged out automatically. New users will not be able to signup during the downtime. There will be no impact on API services, and customers' applications will continue to work.

entry.title: AWS service issues degrading mixer service
entry.content:
Dec 8, 11:42 UTC
Resolved - AWS service issues in AWS us-east-1 have been resolved and traffic has been restored to US datacenter

Dec 7, 19:07 UTC
Monitoring - Rerouting is complete and we are closely monitoring the AWS outage. This incident will be updated when traffic is routed back to the US datacenter.

Dec 7, 17:13 UTC
Identified - Due to AWS service issues in aws-us-east-1, customers may see degraded service related to the mixer (recordings and RTMP). We are currently rerouting all mixers from the US datacenter to the Canada datacenter.

entry.title: Incident on conference creation in EU region
entry.content:
Nov 11, 12:29 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 11, 11:28 UTC
Update - Some other services like REST API have also been impacted and would have reported some SSL error, fixed as well

Nov 11, 11:11 UTC
Monitoring - Problem has started around 10:45 UTC and fixed totally around 11:03 UTC.
We are currently monitoring the service and investigating the root cause.

Nov 11, 11:04 UTC
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Nov 11, 11:04 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

entry.title: dolby.io dashboard down
entry.content:
Jul 7, 18:14 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jul 7, 17:25 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented, ETA within 1 hour.

Investigating - We are currently investigating the issue. The applications are still working, only the access to the dashboard is blocked at the moment.
